name: Highest Mountains? Quiz | Physical Geography | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which country's highest peak is Grossglockner?
questions.explanation:
Austria.

	Grossglockner is 12,457 ft. high or 3,797 meters.

questions.text: Is the Matterhorn the highest peak of Switzerland?
questions.explanation:
no.

	No....the highest peak of Switzerland is called Dufourspitze, shared with Italy, at 15,203 ft. high or 4,634 meters.

questions.text: What is the 3rd highest peak in the world called?
questions.explanation:
Kanchenjunga.

	Kanchenjunga is on the Nepal-India border and measures 28,208 ft. high or 8,598 meters.

questions.text: What is the highest peak of Antarctica?
questions.explanation:
Vinson Massif.

	Vinson Massif is 16,864 ft. high, or 5,140 meters.

questions.text: What is the highest peak in the southern hemisphere?
questions.explanation:
Aconcagua.

	Mt. Aconcagua is 22,831 ft. high, or 6,959 meters.

questions.text: What is the highest mountain on an island, assuming from sea level?
questions.explanation:
Puncak Jaya.

	Puncak Jaya, on the island of New Guinea, is 16,503 ft. high, or 5,030 meters.

questions.text: What is the highest mountain of the former Soviet Union (formerly known as Communism Peak)?
questions.explanation:
Ismail Semani.

	Ismail Semani Peak, formerly known as Communism Peak, is 24,599 feet high, or 7,498 meters.

questions.text: Of the top 10 peaks in North America, are more in Alaska, the Yukon or Mexico...or is there a tie?
questions.explanation:
Yukon.

	Four of the top ten are entirely within the Yukon, with one, St. Elias, being on the Alaska-Yukon border. Three are entirely in Mexico, while only two are entirely in Alaska.

questions.text: What country's highest peak is called Ras Dashen?
questions.explanation:
Ethiopia.

	Ras Dashen is the highest peak of Ethiopia, at 15,158 ft. or 4,620 meters.

questions.text: Last question...do you like this quiz? No, just kidding...actually, the last question is....Aneto, Posets and Perdido are the three highest peaks in what mountain range?
questions.explanation:
Pyrenees.

	They are all Pyrenees....hoped you enjoyed the quiz.
